article_node.title: Settlement seems imminent as hairstylist seeks dismissal of sexual abuse lawsuit against Skip Bayless, Fox
article_node.summary: FS1’s lineup has shifted with new shows like ‘Speak’ and ‘Breakfast Club’ replacing ‘Undisputed,’ while a lawsuit alleges Skip Bayless made unwanted advances toward a Fox Sports hairstylist, seeking damages from him and the network. The case also names Fox exec Charlie Dixon and host Joy Taylor, sparking reactions from former Fox talent. Meanwhile, Shannon Sharpe faced backlash for dismissing Amanda Seales’ autism diagnosis on his podcast, and Ohtani’s Dodgers outing ended in a loss to Colorado, raising concerns about his pitching performance. In college football, UCLA’s recruiting battle between assistants Demetrius Martin and DeShaun Foster’s new staff highlights a strong 2026 class amid conference competition.
